topic.title: Locate and Edit the Console Configuration File

body.p: The Eucalyptus Console configuration settings are stored in the console.ini file.
For Centos and RHEL installations from packages, this file is located in /etc/eucaconsole/console.ini.
The configurable options in the [app:main] section of the console.ini file are:
body.note: The Default Values column denote the default value for a property that is not required, if applicable.

row.entry: Formerly clchost. The IP address or DNS name of the machine running User-Facing Services (UFS), which can be different from the machine running the CLC. For S3 downloads to work, ufshost may not be set to localhost, but specified with the IP or DNS name instead.
Formerly clcport.The port of your cloud front end.
A url that directs users who select 'help' on the account menu to a help page. You can customize for your installation if you do not want our help system.
A URL given to users who have trouble logging in. It may be used to direct them to a cloud admin page or an e-mail address.
When set to true, the AWS tab displays on the login screen.

The name of the region to show by default when the user logs into AWS. Use any value from the Region column recognized by AWS: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region
If you log into a multi-region cloud, the system automatically sets a default region based on which ufshost the console is configured to connect to. The console administrator can specify a different value for a user's default region in order to override the natural default, if needed.
Sets the cache control value for static assets (in seconds).
Set to true to enable browser password saving.
Defaults to true to enable file uploads for S3/Object Storage.
Set to true to disable image caching if users frequently change images outside of the console.
Set to true to enable validation of the SSL certificate supplied by the ufshost (or other endpoint) to secure the connection to the service endpoint.
If certificate validation is on, you may specify a different certificate file than the default.
Set to true to enable very detailed information about communication between the console server and service endpoints. Logs will become cluttered, so do not leave this on under normal operation.
Sets the number of retires used when issuing requests to service endpoints. Adjusting this higher may reduce UI responsiveness.
The default locale if none is specified by browser.
The location of a file that contains session encryption keys.
Set to true to send session cookies over a secure connection only. Needs to be set to false if SSL not configured.
Sets a username to be used when SASL authentication is enabled for memcached. If not set, the memcached connection is unauthenticated.
Sets a password to be used when SASL authentication is enabled for memcached. If not set, the memcached connection is unauthenticated.

body.p: The configurable options in the [server:main] section of the console.ini file are:
body.note: The Default Values column denote the default value for a property that is not required, if applicable.

row.entry: Set to 0.0.0.0 to allow connections from any host. Set to 127.0.0.1 to allow connections from localhost only, which is preferred if running nginx.
The port on which the console can be reached.
The number of worker processes used to service requests. A rule of thumb is double the number of cores plus one.
Specifies a different directory to be used for file uploads, if set. It should have plenty of space to handle large file uploads. Defaults to the system's temp directory.
